website_summaries.verdict: A wholesome grain-free cat food available at a budget-friendly price.
pros: Dry food recipes available in a variety of choices
Affordable alternative to other grain-free cat food options
cons: Cat food contains a high sodium content
Pungent smell may deter a cat from eating the food

website_summaries.verdict: Though a bit more pricey than recipes with grain, it's comparable in wholesomeness and ingredients to premium brands at a value price.
pros: A grain-free formula by a popular brand
No artificial colors, preservatives, flavors, or poultry by-products
Top ingredient is ocean whitefish, a flavor most cats love
cons: A bit pricey, yet still less expensive than several of its competitors' grain-free cat food recipes

customer_reviews.title: Smelly cat, smelly cat, what are they feeding you?
customer_reviews.text: My cat, Kitters, has always been a smelly cat. I'm talking seriously smelly. Like you've got to be kidding, what the hell is wrong with you stinky. I tried various things over the years -- Kitters is five -- and have even taken him to the vet. I had pretty much given up, and thought it was my lot in life to be stuck with a stinky cat. But I recently transitioned from Beyond White Meat Chicken & Oats, which he's been on for a couple of years, to Beyond Grain Free, and viola! no more smelly cat. So two paws up from Kitters, and two thumbs up from me, on Beyond's grain-free formula.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I have just ordered my third bag of this cat food! I have a very skinny, four year old, ittywho throws up every type of Iams food (wet and dry). I have spent a fortune trying to find food she can eat. She loves Purina Beyond Natural Chicken and Egg dry food, and best of all, keeps it down. Since I have always given my cats both wet and dry cat food on a daily basis, we will try Purina Pro Plan canned food!
customer_reviews.author: NanaColleen

customer_reviews.title: Went up 50% in price in the last 3 months!!! Insane!!
customer_reviews.text: Great catfood that use to sell on Amazon for a great price! My 3 cats love it! I have been buying Beyond since April 2016 from Amazon. Last 11 pound bag was in June, and I paid $20,49. Was just about to order again, and the price went up with almost $10,-, that is insane! 50%!! I will look for another brand of natural catfood! 5 stars for quality, 1 star for price!
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth

customer_reviews.title: TLDR: Better Options
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the food seemed fine, but no cat I knew wanted anything to do with this food. My cat likes the blue bag (Purina Beyond), hates this one. She wanted nothing to do with this food, and would barely eat it over starving. So I gave it to my girlfriend to feed outdoor cats by her place. They didn't want it either, and they eat everything. Raccoons and squirrels seem to like it. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SephirTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with Purina
customer_reviews.text: Since I found out my cat has an allergy, I switched to grain free cat food. I have been using Purina Beyond grain-free cat food for about 6 months and there is a definite improvement in my cat's skin. Previously, she licked herself until she bled. Someone suggested I try grain free cat food and I have found this to be the best. I combine it with Purina Grain Free wet food and both cats seem to love it because they clean their bowls. Now my cat has quit licking herself raw and the fur has grown back. I wish I had known this sooner. She is 11 years old and has had this allergy for most of her life.
customer_reviews.author: E A T B

customer_reviews.title: Cats love the taste, but causes severe digestive issues
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this food, and eat it eagerly. HOWEVER, it has caused digestive issues in both (daily vomiting and diarrhea)--something neither of them have had in their 2 1/2 years. I followed the instructions for changing their food; as I always change them up from one grain-free brand to another--usually more expensive brands. I thought I'd give Purina a go. Either I have a bad batch or they both (they are brothers) have allergies to whatever is in this food. I'm tossing it.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Stops our cat from vomiting
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loved his old food and is very particular but he was always vomiting. The vet couldn't figure out what was wrong because nothing fixed the issue. On a whim I changed his food to this grain free and it stopped. We tried a different grain free brand when our store didn't carry this any more and he wouldn't eat the other brand. We accidentally bought the wrong kind (not grain free) and he immediately started vomiting again. Switched him back to this grain free and the problem stopped immediately. Great price on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Moore

customer_reviews.title: Bait and switch
customer_reviews.text: Price went up nearly $10, I’ve purchased two bags of this so far and my cats have really done well with it, but unfortunately now I have to find another “affordable” grain free food for my kitties.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: The search for large kibble plaque buster goes on.
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a large kibble cat food without filler was hard. The vet-prescribed dental therapy dry food is full of corn. I thought I'd found it with Beyond. Tried 3 times to work this into his diet with smelly green diarrhea the result each time. I suspect something not right with ingredients. His system should tolerate non-grain diet; used to eat a fully raw diet, and I eased the change in gradually adding to the Dr prescribed junk food. Gave an extra star for the large kibble which does get those back molars crunching and (hopefully) cleaning plaque. Alas back to junk food.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Mcmurrin

customer_reviews.title: No Fish smell in newest Salmon 11lb bought from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: [Nov.16/2018] Opened the bag and NO fish smell was present to torment me and delight the cat; she is definitely Not impressed. All of my previous 5lb bag orders smelled fishy and the cat was happy. Mfg/Purina: I don’t need a reply, just stop being cheap and refill the salmon grinder bin.
customer_reviews.author: Pete C.

customer_reviews.title: Bye, Purina. You now cost more than me feeding beef to my cat.
customer_reviews.text: Had this on rotation for ... a year? Under Subscribe & Save. In that time, this has gone up 34% in price, and as we top the thirty dollar mark for eleven pounds of food, I’m done. Purina has priced themselves out of a profitable arrangement and I’ve moved to another grain-free brand that my cat loves just as much if not more (duck flavor).
customer_reviews.author: C. Pilson

customer_reviews.title: Change in kibble size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product recently from Amazon and from Petsmart but this 2/20 purchase from Amazon has much larger and flatter kibble size. My cat still gobbles it down but am concerned that this is not a "genuine" product. I will not purchase it from Amazon again. I will contact Purina and update this review. 2/17/2020: I contacted Purina today and there has been no change in kibble size. I gave the rep different codes/numbers from the bag and was assured it was not a "China knock-off". Next bag will be from Petsmart and I will edit this review at that time.
customer_reviews.author: Jezabel's Mama

customer_reviews.title: My 5 y/o cat stopped vomiting
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely happy with this product. My cat had been vomiting his food every so often. Not often enough that we were concerned and took him to the vet but we tried a couple different foods from the pet stores. I googled that it may be allergy to grain. So I bought this about a month ago and he has since stopped vomiting! I purchased a larger size recently and both him and my kitten seem happy with it. I'm not sure if it was just the grain free aspect but I'm pleased it worked. Highly recommend trying this for someone looking to remedy their cat.
customer_reviews.author: Zoda

customer_reviews.title: replacement for Muse...cats still like it
customer_reviews.text: Since it has become impossible to get Purina Muse catfood during the pandemic, we had to fall back on what we used to feed our babies. No major changes in formulation but Purina is still sketchy as where ingredients are sourced from on the bag. Kibble size is the same but the vastly prefer the chicken and egg receipe over both types of fish. No digestive, coat, or respiratory issues have arisen in over 6 weeks. Just got back from the vet with all 4 of them. Fecal cultures were fine. Litter boxes are the same as with Muse. FYI: I am copying this review to the other two flavors since we've been through 4 bags of each.
customer_reviews.author: Nonamemarine

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS FOR YOUR CATS PLEASEEE!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT buy this for your cats!!!! I recently switched to this food in an attempt to not have to buy the expensive food our vets sells for kitties and BOTH of my cats are itching like crazy and now have several spots without fur from constant itching and scratching. I normally wouldnt swear off something so easily because I get animals can have allergies to things too but BOTH of my cats are affected terrible eating this food!!!
customer_reviews.author: BeccaL

customer_reviews.title: So glad I found this cat food
customer_reviews.text: I knew I was going to adopt a new cat, so I started searching for the best quality cat food I could find at normal stores. I soon found myself with a new adopted adult cat who had been treated badly before coming to live with me. He was so cautious about everything in my house, until he got a whiff of this food. He loved it, and soon he started to relax and enjoy his new home more. I love the quality of the ingredients, and that the salmon is listed first. He loves the taste. I’m a happy cat owner thanks to this food.
customer_reviews.author: Laughing Crow Studio

customer_reviews.title: Huge price INCREASE
customer_reviews.text: This food is okay, due to this price increase I am moved to try something more reasonable. My cats still throw up with this food. This is getting way too pricey though...
customer_reviews.author: KNOLAN

customer_reviews.title: Coronavirus Price Hike
customer_reviews.text: Disgusting. Been buying this for a while, but raising prices right now amid all that is going on is beyond trashy.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Cats will not eat this.
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats just won't eat this. I keep trying, even mixing it with other food, but they will have nothing to do with it. I have one cat that is never picky, and she won't touch this. My cats eat other Purina cat foods, so I'm not sure if it's just the flavor of this or if something is actually wrong with this bag. I've never had them be this stubborn with a food, and I made the mistake of getting a large bag so it's a huge waste of money. Very disappointed with this and can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: perfect for cats with finicky stomachs.
customer_reviews.text: i went through so many foods trying to find one that didn't make my cat vomit after eating. i thought it might be a grain sensitivity, but even other grain-free foods triggered that response. upside: she hasn't vomited at all in the months since starting her on this food and has finally managed to get up to a healthy weight for the first time since we rescued her. downside: some of my other cats have taken greedy nibbles out of her dish and have decided that their old food isn't good enough anymore.
customer_reviews.author: a m p

customer_reviews.title: Solved my cat's poop problems! (edit: okay, not permanently)
customer_reviews.text: I have two sphynxes and they are not picky eaters at all but one of them had chronic soft, smelly stool. We tried a lot of sensitive stomach/probiotic dry foods (various other Purina varieties, Blue Buffalo, etc). to see if we could get it better and none of them worked. We switched to this and our cats not only have solid poops but also just freaking love this stuff. They try to climb inside the bag when it's open. EDIT/UPDATE: The cat with the sensitive stomach went back to having wet and smelly poops again. Still 3 stars because the other cat is fine and is a fiend for this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: ZToaster

customer_reviews.title: My cats gluten free diet
customer_reviews.text: When my vet told me that my cat had an allergy to most likely the grains in his food and needed a grain free diet (gluten free) I almost passed out. Seriously? Put my cat on a gluten free diet? OMG. Well I did some searching and stores don’t really carry it so I took a chance on this food based on other reviews. I can say after a month there are no more ear infections and a whole lot less cat puke in my house. Who knew a cat needed a GF diet?
customer_reviews.author: Jeana

customer_reviews.title: All the cats seem to like it and the queen has all of her fur ...
customer_reviews.text: Started using this when my oldest kitty began losing her fur on her ears and I suspected an allergy., It can be difficult finding an affordable grain-free option, but this has worked for us. All the cats seem to like it and the queen has all of her fur back.
customer_reviews.author: Lyss

customer_reviews.title: Cats were happy 🙏🏼 Their poop doesn’t get two stinky.... lol
customer_reviews.text: Cats seem to like it. I purchased to replace Blue Wilderness. It was purchased by General Mills 🤨 my dogs haven’t been as enthusiastic over their $54 now 20 lb bag down from 24 two years ago. Price up $5 MY CATS WERE VOMITING THEIR $33 11lb cat food up over the last few months. Praying this sits well with them after mixing it 1/3 with their current food to switch them over. Hopefully their will be no diarrhea or vomiting over the next week or two. Always mix food for minimum of a week when switching.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it. Less barfing
customer_reviews.text: I didnt personally try it but my hybrid savannah loved it. Good ingredients and in a world where stores have isles and isles of dog food choices, cats get like and end cap selection. Purina has been my top choice for my grain free and high protein diet needs cat. We just adopted a bengal redcue and his stomach issues have gotten much better and hes no longer harfing up food. Little pricey but my cats deserve quality food that purina has made
customer_reviews.author: Chris cooney

customer_reviews.title: ... started using this so I can't give a really great review. However my cats really like it & ...
customer_reviews.text: I just started using this so I can't give a really great review. However my cats really like it & the size of the pieces seem to be good for my elderly cat. The fact that is reasonable price & grain free is very nice. So corn isn't the 2nd ingredient like lots of cat food brands have. It states no ingredients from China on it. Plus is states no corn, wheat, soy. No artificial preservatives.
customer_reviews.author: J-d-s

customer_reviews.title: Love straight to the stomach!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 boy cats are so excited every time their cat food is delivered! I have been feeding my boys this now for 2 years and no issues with this food. Looked hard for a suitable food that they would enjoy and best of all I like the fact that are eating no added fillers that could and do cause health issues!!!!! A+++++++
customer_reviews.author: Jim Or Marlene Hiland

customer_reviews.title: UTI problem
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this for your cat! It has a lot of salt and can cause kidney/UTI problem. My cat was perfect healthy with Natural Balance for years, I thought to change some flavor for her, so I got this one. After eating this for 3 weeks, my cat started to have big urinate problem, she went to bathroom every 5 mins and could only pee several drops. Then I immediately stop this food and feed her with wet food only, and with several medicines, she fully recovered after a week, it was so scary!
customer_reviews.author: Yue Zhang

customer_reviews.title: They love it!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a cat food that all of my six cats can agree on. With a lot of the other foods I have tried there was always one who turned their nose up at it. Even the Purina Beyond with chicken did not do the trick. However, they all love the salmon with egg and sweet potato. It had better be good since I have to buy four bags a month and cannot afford to make a mistake that results in having to throw it away or give it to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: brucem1952

customer_reviews.title: Good choice in dry cat food.
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats pretty much stopped eating their regular dry food so I started looking around for something else. I read good things about this food so thought I'd try it. It's good cat food and my cats love it BUT it's kind of rich and they thew up almost as much of it as they kept down. So, I mixed it with their regular brand of dry foot and now the cat that wouldn't eat their original food is eating the blend, they don't throw it up and everyone is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi Girl

customer_reviews.title: Picky cat loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has always been thin, but healthy. With that being said, since I started using this food for him, he feels like he has more muscle tone. I didn't think going grain free would have this much of a noticeable difference to him. I have also noticed that the little box has less poo in it to and I think this is because his body is actually using this food instead of going right thru him. I switch between the fish and the chicken one each month, but he loves the fish one more.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda B

customer_reviews.title: Made one sick
customer_reviews.text: Two cats... One with an iron stomach and one with a delicate stomach. Iron guts loved it with no problem but the other throws up every bit she eats. Cats are so individual and every one will have different needs so I think it's trial and error for each. My delicate stomach cat does best with grain free lamb wet food. She does a OK with science diet for sensitive stomachs dry food. I give her probiotic drops in her wet food. Cats can be tough to figure out!
customer_reviews.author: YaymeeT

customer_reviews.title: Cat"s like it. Cheaper here.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase almost every month. Can't beat the price. Cat's realy enjoy this food. So the say. They do have three different foods at all times. Wet food once a week. They are all heathy. Was using Purina one. They changed the recipe. Added some soft stuff to it. Made one of my cat's upchuck two or more times a day. Took a few day's to figure out it was the Purina one. Other cat's hardly ate it. Did not like the new taste.
customer_reviews.author: Accutek

customer_reviews.title: Good food and a nice coat as a result!
customer_reviews.text: At first my cat turned his nose at this brand and refused to touch it for 3 days. Then his hunger got the better of him and he ate. When I put a different food brand in his bowl, he looked at me with, "What happened to the other stuff?" So I combined the two, and now he refuses to eat the other food without this one added to it! However, I have found this brand priced much lower in my local store. Give it a try, and give it a few days. If your cat doesn't scarf it down, they might just be playing it stubborn. =-)
customer_reviews.author: Anne Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Moths & Larvae
customer_reviews.text: The 11 pound bag of this cat food was received promptly, so I was thankful for that. But -- and this has never happened before -- the bag contains moths & tiny larvae! The cat food itself looks okay, but I'm afraid to feed it to my cats because of the bugs! I may contact Amazon next week to ask if anything can be done. Obviously, the bag has already been opened -- and out flew small moths! Normally, my cats love this food.
customer_reviews.author: Customer1

customer_reviews.title: All three of my cats love the food and are at the right weight do ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 two year old cats and one 12 old cat. They are very healthy and are doing very well since I started using Beyond My 12 year old cat had urinary track infection on a consistent basis. I purchased special expensive food from the vet, witch helped. Since I have changed to no grain natural food my 12 year cat has had no issue. All three of my cats love the food and are at the right weight do to not having the grain in the food..
customer_reviews.author: Prudence Marston

customer_reviews.title: Ants??
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched to this brand, and the cats seem to like it alright. My dissatisfaction an insect issue. The first time it was delivered, the box sat on my porch for a few hours. When I opened the box there were a ton if ants inside. I thought it was weird as this has never happened with other pet food orders, but let it pass. This next order only sat outside for a few minutes, and yet when I opened the box- full of dead ants. Guess if I continue with this product I'll have to buy in store instead of through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Quality Cat Food
customer_reviews.text: Quality cat food. I can easily see the difference in healthier cats after a couple of months feeding this. Cats are carnivores .. they require MEAT for a proper diet. Much has been written re: cats not being able to properly digest & process corn/wheat/"fillers" & other grains into good, usable nutrition. I believe it. Yes, it is more expensive but the shine of their coats, the lean muscle that now replaces fat, the energy in their all around actions makes it worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Sue O.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of sodium, your cat is going to drink so much water and pee a lot
customer_reviews.text: I got this to try to get my picky cat to have solid stool, he did however I had to trick him into eating it with drizzling tuna juice. My cats started drinking an insane amount of water after eating this, I stopped feeding it to them because it appears to have a high sodium content and they were urinating way too much for me to keep up with their litter. One liked it, the other did not. Half the bag is still sitting on my shelf. I switched to a prescription can food for kidneys from the vet and they are happier with that
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the real deal
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this food. When I needed to put the kitties on a diet (because they got a little winter chunk on their bellies), I followed the guidelines on the package and within a couple of days, the cats had adapted to the limited feeding and lost weight as well. The poops are small and have very little smell. I have found that you get what you pay for, and this food is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Pluff mud studios

customer_reviews.title: Eskimo and Bear approved
customer_reviews.text: My young guys (1 &1/2 and 2&1/2), are quite picky, but they like this food. As a matter of fact, it's the only grain-free food of any kind that I have ever gotten them to eat. About 60 or 70 % of their diet is wet food, but I am glad that there is a good quality dry food that they like. I even got my mother's 12 + year old cats eating this. I have deducted one star for the price. It is quite expensive, which is hard for someone on a limited budget, a VERY limited budget, but I have a duty to provide nutritious food for the rugrats. I recommend it to anyone who can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: birder1

customer_reviews.title: MY THREE CATS LOVE THIS BRAND
customer_reviews.text: EVEN FRIENDS I HAVE RECOMMENDED THIS BRAND TO SAY THE SAME THING, THEIR CATS LOVE IT TOO! MY ONLY CONCERN IS THAT MY ONE CAT MOSTLY EATS THIS KIBBLE AND SLEEPS A LOT, AND HE'S BEEN GAINING WEIGHT. PROBABLY NOT THE BEST CHOICE IF YOUR CAT HAS A TENDENCY TO BECOME OVERWEIGHT. OR AS I DO, I TRY TO GIVE HIM LESS EACH DAY AND MORE WET FOOD.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Arcon

customer_reviews.title: Picky cats enjoy it and isn't their liking the good half the battle?
customer_reviews.text: We have two fluffs on this food. There are a number of flavors and we have tried a few but this one seems to be their favorites. We put them on grain free because one of the girls had an issue. It was suggested we go grain free for her and it did the trick. Both girls are thriving on this food (ok, so one needs to lose enough weight to create another whole cat) but they are playful and silly and healthy and happy. And, the issue that our sweet polydactyl had had been resolved. Can you ask for more? Healthy, happy, silly playful fluffs who enjoy their food?
customer_reviews.author: Domaru

customer_reviews.title: What were you thinking, Amazon?
customer_reviews.text: This food itself is great and our cats love it. The only reason I docked a star is because of how Amazon shipped it. It arrived on our doorstep without a box. Just the bag of food with a shipping label on it. I don't appreciate that one bit. The bag could have easily torn. Come on, Amazon. That's just ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Kerby

customer_reviews.title: plus my cats seem to like it. The only reason this didn't get 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Grain free and decently healthy, plus my cats seem to like it. The only reason this didn't get 5 stars was because there are still healthier options for only a couple dollars more
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this stuff. You'd think they would have grown tired of the same thing all the time but, they haven't. I feed them both wet food and this dry food. Two of my 3 cats are meowing for the wet food as I dish it out. My third cat is ignoring the wet food for this dry food. I have one of those gravity feeders so when the bowl gets empty the food falls down into the bowl. I have to fill that thing like every 3 days. As long as they keep liking it I'll keep buying it. I have it on auto ship
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves this
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food. She’d previously only been eating wet cat food. When I opened this bag she went nuts!! I slowly introduced it to her and no tummy issues. I still feed the majority of her diet as wet food and she gets a bit of this as a supplement. She’s a tiny girl and can use extra calories so I mostly use this as a treat and extra food she can nibble through the day. It’s more convenient to be able to leave some dry food out especially if we are all gone for a bit.
customer_reviews.author: S.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a healthy fur coat.
customer_reviews.text: I have an 8 year old, a 3 year old and a 2 year old. They are all on this same food and they love it. The egg has made their coats shiny and healthy and glossy. The price is kind of mid range. My one complaint is that I can't find it in a larger bag. And also the packaging for this and the chicken and oatmeal are almost identical. Be careful not to get the wrong one!! My 2 younger ones won't touch the chicken and oatmeal.
customer_reviews.author: Lulahbel

customer_reviews.title: My kitty is satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes this food just fine. I am trying to keep her healthy with food free of those "unhealthy" grains. She seems to be doing okay so.... I'd like to be able to buy a larger bag and possibly save money but didn't see that offered. Easy to reorder which I'll do as long as the trial period on Prime lasts. (o:
customer_reviews.author: VTGina

customer_reviews.title: Replaced expensive prescription food
customer_reviews.text: We discovered our boy was sensitive to wheat gluten and the vet recommended Science Diet prescription food. It became difficult to obtain after we moved, and quite expensive. Cat was throwing up once or twice a day until we found this food. No more throw up! Now everyone in the house seems to be happy. He seemed not to like the taste of a few other grain-free options, but this one has a mild fish smell and he seems to enjoy it -- at less than half the price of prescription food. Win!
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Cats like it, but breaks down into dust..
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this product at first. Cats are all different in what they like and I have two, one will eat anything and one is super finicky and they both loved it. Unfortunately this food breaks down into food dust that coated the bottom of the bowl and gave them chin acne. My finicky cat also threw it up a few times and stopped again as soon as I switched food. (Wish I’d have taken a photo)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my boy's tummy happy, and he loves the food!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in order to switch my cat to something more affordable than the insanely pricey stuff he had previously been on, while keeping him on a grain-free diet. He loves the food, gets excited whenever he smells it, and his tummy does very well on it (he's very sensitive to diet changes, but he always does well on this).
customer_reviews.author: Gigabitz

customer_reviews.title: Two paws down from my kitties
customer_reviews.text: My two kitties did NOT like this food whatsoever. I was trying to find an alternative to the pricier Iams Grain Free Naturals (which they both love). However, this is not it. Guess it's back to Iams. Iams may not be a premium food like Wellness, but I had 3 Persians live for 16 years on Iams so it must not be that bad!
customer_reviews.author: S. SmithTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Better for my cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat was having issues throwing up after eating. The vet suggested a change in food before pursuing anything more aggressive and after some research on cat foods I bought this. We are on the third bag and there have been no more issues. What a relief it was resolved with just a food change!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Richerson

customer_reviews.title: Good Food with No Chicken By-Products
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my cat seems to have an allergy to chicken by-product meal and this is not supposed to contain any. So far she seems to like the flavor, and I haven't seen any digestive issues for 2 days. She has IBS problems, so I try to get the most easily digestive foods. The only thing that could be improved is the size of the kibble. We prefer very small pieces, and this was about the size of a thumbnail. Good food, so far!
customer_reviews.author: Jan Chilton

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS FOOD!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS CAT FOOD. My cats are healthy inside cats. I noticed them throwing up and thought it was hairballs. My cat starting having issues with breathing all of the sudden and trying to throw up, like he was choking on something. He wasn’t though. He was drooling from the mouth and then died within 15 minutes. I though that it may have been heart issues or something. My other cat continued to vomit the food up, whole. I finally put two and two together... I stopped the food and my other cat is much better now. Has not thrown up once since: please please please don’t purchase this food.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Beyond
customer_reviews.text: A dry cat food that is very healthy for cats. I has real ingredients, and my cats love this. I use to buy the "expensive" brands because I thought that was the right food for them. When I compared the ingredients, wow, what a difference. I fill the bowls twice a day, and in the morning the bowls are empty. The cats appear to have more energy and have lost some weight. Great product. Yes, it is pricey. The real ingredients is what sold me on this product. I do recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: dpuz

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this and they are actually losing some of their unhealthy fat since switching to this cat food. Also I have one cat who has had terrible stomach problems all of his 11 years. He has switched to this food instead of the Iams Digestive Care and all of his stomach problems have stopped. I would highly recommend this product and all four of my cats recommend it too!!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie F. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Cats love this food!
customer_reviews.text: I originally tried Beyond chicken because of the ingredients, and glad I did. It doesn't matter how good ingredients are if cats won't eat it, and our 3 cats love it. So many cat foods contain tuna which is high in mercury, (An aside, its recommended pregnant women only eat tuna once a week because of this). SInce mercury is cumulative in the body, what can that be doing to our cats!?! I try to avoid all cat foods that include tuna, and Beyond chicken varieties fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: CLWood

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: While my cat certainly prefers wet food to dry, I have been feeding her this brand and formula for a few years and she is healthier than when I paid less attention to the quality of her food. She definitely has a preference in dry foods, as she rejected the Crave dry food until she absolutely had to eat it. I like that the first ingredients in Purina Beyond formulas are whole foods and they are fortified with minerals my cat needs to live a long, healthy life.
customer_reviews.author: esmerelda villa lobos

customer_reviews.title: Very good replacement for a grain based feed
customer_reviews.text: After reading about feeding grained based feeds to our animals, I decided to try grain free with exception I mix 3 different kinds of dry food in equal parts because some cats don't you like messing with their food. My cats love the mixture I made for them and have to watch how much they eat for putting too much weight on. My cats also get about 3 ounces of wet food a day every day. Fancy Feast or Friskies wet food
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Old kitties love it!
customer_reviews.text: My one cat has inflammatory bowel disease and has been recovering from the weight loss prior to his diagnosis. My other cat was fat from eating my sick kitty’s food. Tried this for both, sick kitty had been eating GI specific food along with his medication and wanted to try him on high quality food and see if he improved to not need the specialized food. They both love it, major fishy smell but that’s what makes it good, right? He’s putting on some weight again and fat kitty goes crazy over it, too. Not any more fat with it though. They are seniors and need a higher quality food and I think this is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: NicoleD58

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent cat attitudes towards consuming product
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Sale. Got a few bags; three cats ate thru 1/2 bag then lost weight. Didn't get too thrilled at eating time anymore ...would just walk off. Uncertain if a quality control or what but topped it off with BB & they finished the bag. Won't buy this brand on purchase as I have prior and it seems inconsistent at my 3 cats enjoying it. One bag great another so so. Since weight loss and sheen diminished nope.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda123

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this
customer_reviews.text: My cats..one is now deceased..but he was almost 19..the other is now 9...really did benefit by eating grain free food. I was hoping it was just a gimmick..but their ears immediately cleared up from all that dark junk that was in there. They both stopped vomiting when I switched to grain free. Yes, it is more expensive than some of the other cat food out there, but it is not as expensive as a vet visit. Also, there is more expensive food, but my cat eats this with no side effects, only positive effects, so why pay more..
customer_reviews.author: PamelaLeigh61

customer_reviews.title: FIsh Formula: Made my cats poop smell (worse, I mean)
customer_reviews.text: I have picky, demanding cats that reject food or vomit after eating. This stopped the vomiting, which is very nice, so I like the concept. My cats also liked it. Unfortunately, you can smell that they have been eating a fish-based food afterwards. Seriously. Their litter box smelled like a fish market selling last week's catch. No, thank you. BTW, The chicken formula does NOT have this smell as a side effect.
customer_reviews.author: CleverReviewName

customer_reviews.title: Cats love this food, but not great for them
customer_reviews.text: All of my cats love this stuff, even my picky eater. I've been mixing it with their prior food and they are picking this out of the bowl and leaving the other food in the bowl. Update: once I switched my cats entirely to this food from their prior high quality food, 2 of the 4 started vomiting excessively and one is having urinary issues (spraying where he never did before.) Am putting them back on the food they were on before where we did not have these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Winner, winner!  Chicken dinner!
customer_reviews.text: When our vet encouraged us to switch our kitties to grain-free food, it took quite a few tries before we found one that they liked. They HATED the more expensive cyan bison brand and absolutely refused to eat it. That stuff also stank horribly! After testing 5 other brands, we were so relieved to find that they loved the Purina which had the added benefit of being less expensive. Winner!
customer_reviews.author: BranWick

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: My cats eat canned wet food during the day, but at night I leave out dry food. I was giving them Purina True Instinct, also grain free, and they liked it, but one of them threw up almost every day. I decided to try this one to see if it would make a difference in the throwing up. I'm very happy to report that they like it and it's been 5 days without a single episode of throwing up! Hallelujah!
customer_reviews.author: Nanc

customer_reviews.title: Controls weight, but causes hairballs and constipation
customer_reviews.text: This food kept my lazy indoor cat at a svelte weight, but caused issues with constipation and hairballs. I had to switch her to the Iams Indoor/Hairball formula, even though that one's more calorie dense. That food keeps her regular and erases hairball issues completely unlike this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bell

customer_reviews.title: My cats really liked this cat food but would not eat it after ...
customer_reviews.text: My cats really liked this cat food but would not eat it after it had been opened over a week. I wondered if the oil might change the smell? Although... I changed to Science Diet due to their coats and skin being dry so how much oil can there be? They stopped eating the Science Diet and I have them on a Purina dry and am supplimenting to take care of their coats. They seem fine now but I really liked this cat food. I still give it to them as a snack from the smaller bags. They seem to enjoy the shape as well as the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Cerulean Artist

customer_reviews.title: Food arrived stale
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this product every month at my local grocery store, and my cat usually enjoys it. When I ordered it here for the first time in a larger quantity, the bag contained stale, hard, dried out food that my cat can't eat. The expiration date says February of 2020, but the food is so hard and dry that it's almost completely inedible, and it does not resemble at all the identical bags I have purchased at the store. I'm not sure if there was a problem with the packaging, but this is not the quality product that I normally have purchased and will have to switch to another brand if it happens again.
customer_reviews.author: Erin McGovern

customer_reviews.title: A very happy cat!
customer_reviews.text: We have a cat with a compromised immune system and she's a picky eater. We feed her only grain-free foods but she doesn't always like them (and we've tried so many) so it's a real waste of time and money. We decided to gove the Purina Beyond a try since it had a lot of great ingredients. Chicken or beef doesn't interest her so we tried the ocean whitefish & egg and she loves it! Definitely, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl R.

customer_reviews.title: both cats hate this flavor
customer_reviews.text: this is the 3rd flavor I had bought -all grain free - the chicken one they like best they have pretty much rejected this Salmon Egg and Sweet Potato flavor - not sure I can get them to even eat the rest of the sack not going to buy it again
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: I'ts not that I hate it. My cat's don't mind it at all
customer_reviews.text: I'ts not that I hate it. My cat's don't mind it at all. The problem is they throw it right back up. Had to go back to old cat food after a week of food spots all over my floor.
customer_reviews.author: Zero Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Cats seem to love it
customer_reviews.text: Someone recently recommended I try this brand over the one I was using, due to the latter's heavy metal content. Doing a little reading, I thought this would be worth a try. I bought a small bag of their old food to slowly mix in with this... From the first feeding, the cats started to pick around the old food and only eat the new food. They seem very happy with the food, and a few days in I see no adverse effects.
customer_reviews.author: shawn m espinosa

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this stuff. I switched to grain free cat food about a year ago and her hairballs almost miraculosly stopped, but I could tell she wasn't really thrilled with tje food. (I have tried bland diets myself, I get it.) I got a free sample of this brand, though, and she was climbing all over me before I even got it open, so the next time I got her food, I went for this. She still seems to be excited about it, so I guess it must taste good. She has been through a few bags now and still no hairballs, too, so we are both happy.
customer_reviews.author: KMM

customer_reviews.title: Had to feed too much, too often...
customer_reviews.text: Our 1 Year old Ragdoll could not get enough of this food... had to seemingly over feed to satisfy her. Tried this brand after serving NOW BRAND kitten for her first year, had to go back and now down to a normal 2 servings a day. I AM NOT SAYING SHE DIDN'T LOVE IT, just that it didn’t satisfy her appetite. Nothing AT ALL against the brand or the seller- just my experience -
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I'm Speaking for My Cat Here...
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 yo tortie will not eat anything but this kibble. We've tried human tuna, steak, chicken, and salmon; Gerber's chicken & turkey baby food, all manner of premium cans (Wellness, Organic, Nutro Max Cat, Fromm, etc) and cheap cans (Friskies) and everything in between (Fancy Feast, Newman's). She will nibble human tuna and Fussie Cat, but then quickly goes back to the kibble dish. Love the fast, convenient re-ordering.
customer_reviews.author: LeadMare in CA

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but
customer_reviews.text: I'd noticed the price sky-rocketed. I didn't exactly get it before all this started, but I do feel fortunate to have an extra bag on hand. This is a tough one; it's been our standard for a couple of years. Hey what's the story on the few deaths I've seen in the reviews? Sorry China, but you deserve this -- where did it come from? I'll need this answer before I buy it, or anything edible, from there.
customer_reviews.author: WhosKiddingWhom

customer_reviews.title: Everyone loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We had 4 cats and autofeeders with 2 different flavors. They all preferred this one. We tried different ones in the second feeder, but they all like this best. I gave a bag to my mother for her cat. She called and asked me to add it to her subscribe & save. That may be my favorite aspect--having it automatically delivered each month, so we never run out.
customer_reviews.author: JoLynn Oten

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Tasted, Kitty Approved!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Purina Grain Free food because the oldest of my four kitties started throwing up frequently. Some research suggested making a switch to grain free food. All four of my feline companions like the grain free food. We've tried the Salmon, the Whitefish and the Chicken varieties. My old girl has stopped redecorating my apartment with puke. Yayyy!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Taggart

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Loves This
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loves this dry cat food and it's grain free. I sometimes mix a tiny bit of wet food in with it to give him a little more moisture and, of course, keep fresh water out at all times. He's very healthy and has a beautiful coat. Also, his stools are perfect and easy to scoop from the litter box. I highly recommend this product. Wouldn't give him anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Divinity Love

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love this!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I wasn't sure if our cats would like this but they do. Normally our cats are finicky over dry food and we have a different grain free varieies for each cat. No more, both cats love this food. One cat who would barely eat dry food now gobbles this one down. Our cats have been off grain based foods for a while now and this one is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: MrPenguinie

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes it!
customer_reviews.text: This a good choice if you're looking to switch to grain free for better health, but not wanting to spend $50+ per bag on a vet brand. My cat (5 year old spayed indoor-only) is picky and doesn't like most dry food, but she seems to like this a lot. I feed 1/2 cup per day in the morning, along with one "single serving" container of wet food in the evening. Keeps her full and energetic but still a healthy weight.
customer_reviews.author: Emililly

customer_reviews.title: Moths in cat food
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this product many times. This last time I have noticed moths and finally tracked them to the container of catfood.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Stenger

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Catfood
customer_reviews.text: I have to laugh at the rating questions that ask me to rate "flavor" and "scent". I gave each 5 stars because my cat really likes it (she's been eating it for years) and it smells like whitefish when you put your nose close to it - not like grain or whatever it is the others smell like. Good price here and arrives very fast. Will continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: VogueFauxReal

customer_reviews.title: Won The Taste Test
customer_reviews.text: I've tried them all from wet, to dry kibble, to raw cat food, and for the last 2yrs my boy would only eat Beyond "White Meat Chicken & Egg" recipe. For a change I bought this Beyond's NEW! "High Protein Icelandic Arctic Char". In a side by side taste test against his old favorite, my boy chose the NEW! "High Protein Icelandic Arctic Char". Best of all, he had no side affects from the change.
customer_reviews.author: Cremant

customer_reviews.title: Special mind food
customer_reviews.text: The cat that is suppose to get this with diabetic meal is enjoyed the the other 4. The others are chased from her meals at her special time. When we don't add these great treats to her food she won't eat not the others touch the diabetic food. And when these treats aren't added to any food they all turn their heads. Wiggle a finger into the diabetic food & ALL what.
customer_reviews.author: Opa Craig

customer_reviews.title: beyond dry cat food
customer_reviews.text: I prefer to feed my cats food that is good for them, does not upset their digestion and does not smell terrible upon exit. Purina Beyond does that. My cats have done very good on it. However, it has become so expensive I will be forced to seek as healthy a food as can be found that I can wedge into my $1200 a month income. Any suggestions would be welcome.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Formula Change?
customer_reviews.text: Bought Chicken & Egg couple months back and all my 4 babies just can't get enough of it. The bowls are polished clean every time. Thought I have finally found the gem to satisfied all. I then order another bag of chicken and tuna. The chicken look darker this time around but I didn't think anything of it. 2 weeks into it, all 4 kitties sniffed and walk away. Odd, can't be all 4 being finicky at the same time. I tried the tuna. What kitties walk away from tuna so I thought. Well, mine did...and all 4 again! Is it my babies ganging up or the formula?
customer_reviews.author: Kid

customer_reviews.title: My cat is thrilled
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food. He's nearly 12 years old, indoor-only, and healthy except for a heart murmur. I've fed him mostly high-end brands for many years, and he's done well on them, but seemed a little bored. So I mixed some of this into his regular food. Man, he was excited. You'd have thought he hadn't eaten in four days. I'm enough of a pet food snob to not trust a grocery store band as an exclusive source of nutrition, but I mix some of this into my cat's dish to keep him happy.
customer_reviews.author: LCMR

customer_reviews.title: Grain free is important for my cats---
customer_reviews.text: My cats have always loved the Purina Grain Free cat food. My cats weigh over sixteen pounds each and that is the only problem I see with this product. I have tried a weight management, dry cat food that my cats would not touch. As I have not made any decisions as to the next weight management product to try, I will continue to order the cat food they love!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn D. Little

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I've found for the price
customer_reviews.text: Well, first off the cats love it, which I guess is the most important thing. I was feeding them Blue Buffalo Wilderness grain free hard food, which is much more expensive and still contains by products. I've had them on it for two months and so far they have done really well on this stuff, I can already tell the difference in the litterbox (less stinky poops). Plus, getting the big bag on subscribe & save really makes it a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Helfenbein

customer_reviews.title: I've been using this a hedgehog feed, and I'm really happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this originally because of the high Selenium, Vitamin E, and fish oil concentrations since my female hedgehog appears to have Wobbly Hedgehog syndrome and that's been suggested may help slow down development of further symptoms. It's really high quality food with fat, protein, and fiber all within what limits I could find for hedgehogs and the seem to love it, plus the pieces are small enough they can easily eat them. Possibly related is that my female doesn't seem to be getting worse, so I'm more than content with this feed. I will continue to buy this and would recommend it highly :)
customer_reviews.author: Jessica RileyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, Grain-Free, & they love it!
customer_reviews.text: We love Beyond Grain Free. My two young cats have been on grain free food since babies. I like to rotate their food, and in rotating wet foods, found this brand wet food at the grocery store and they seem to love it, so I decided to give this a try & they love it. My pickier cat goes NUTS as soon as she hears the bag crinkle. The value of buying this 11lb bag Amazon is amazing; it's the same price as most 5lb bags of grain free. I still mix in other brands of all natural grain free food from time to time to give them a variety, but this has become our new staple.
customer_reviews.author: cms

customer_reviews.title: Saved my cat's life!
customer_reviews.text: This product saved my cat's life. Seriously. Bella was eating a very expensive brand (which shall remain nameless) and she went into convulsions, had diarrhea, couldn't walk right and was vomiting. Purina's Beyond brand pulled her out of that horrible nightmare. She loves the food! I feed her the dry, the wet, and give her the treats every now and then. I and my Bella are fans forever and will never purchase anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Turner

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: I'm absolutely in awe here...she hasn't thrown up once since she started eating this. She threw up the Oceanfish one, but the Chicken- man, after years of trying different food after different food, finally found one that works. So, I think this food has helped me find out she's been allergic to any and all kinds of fish. Thanks for that, Purina.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Cat Gives it Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the grain-free aspect, and it just so happens our cat loooooves this stuff!. She's primarily a wet-food cat, but this is what we leave in her dispenser when we go away for a couple days, and we also use it for occasional treats. Cat gets very excited when we go for the bag of kitty crack. She's never had any digestive issues with switching between this and her canned Friskies and Fancy Feast pates, maybe because Beyond is also a Purina product.
customer_reviews.author: Midas Gold

customer_reviews.title: My cat keeps throwing it up
customer_reviews.text: We feed our cat one meal of dry food (this brand) and one meal of canned wet food each day. She never had any issues with the wet food, but she frequently throws up after eating this. We are not sure why... need to switch brands perhaps...
customer_reviews.author: B. Dong

customer_reviews.title: Picky cat loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has always been thin, but healthy. With that being said, since I started using this food for him, he feels like he has more muscle tone. I didn't think going grain free would have this much of a noticeable difference to him. I have also noticed that the little box has less poo in it to and I think this is because his body is actually using this food instead of going right thru him. I switch between the fish and the chicken one each month, but he loves the fish one more.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda B

product_meta.title: Purina Beyond Grain Free, Natural, Adult Dry Cat Food
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Ocean Whitefish & Egg| Size:11 lb. BagFeed your cat the way nature intended with Purina Beyond Simply Grain Free Ocean Whitefish & Egg Recipe adult dry cat food. Our pet nutritionist selects high-quality, recognizable ingredients from our trusted sources for this limited-ingredient cat food recipe. Our high-protein cat food starts with real ocean whitefish as the #1 ingredient and is accented with eggs and sweet potato. Plus, natural probiotics in this gluten free and grain-free cat food formula supports her digestive health. Our natural cat food with added vitamins, minerals and nutrients provides the 100% complete and balanced nutrition your adult cat needs. Add extra variety, flavor and protein to her diet and support her hydration by mixing this dry cat food with our wet cat foods or complements. We produce this Beyond cat food in U.S. facilities, where we take positive steps to make it good for your pet and good for the planet, like improving water use efficiency and reducing waste.
feature_bullets: One (1) 11 lb. Bag - Purina Beyond Grain Free, Natural Dry Cat Food, Simply Grain Free Ocean Whitefish & Egg Recipe
High protein cat food with real ocean whitefish as the #1 ingredient
Gluten and grain free, limited ingredient cat food with natural probiotics for digestive health
With no corn, wheat, soy, poultry by-product meal, or artificial colors, flavors or preservatives
Add extra variety and flavor and support hydration with Purina Beyond wet cat food or toppers

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
